bibl.title: Irregular Levies and the Impact of the Roman Army in Egypt.

with the aid of Olivier HEKSTER and Gerda DE KLEIJN, The Impact of the Roman Army (200 BC - AD 476). Economic, Social, Political, Religious and Cultural Aspects. Proceedings of the Sixth Workshop of the International Network Impact of Empire (Roman Empire, 200 B.C. - A.D. 476), Capri, March 29 - April 2, 2005
bibl.author: ADAMS, Colin

bibl.note: P. Panop. Beatty 1-2 show that the requisitions for visits of the emperor (as well as of other state officials) had a significant impact at the local level, including in terms of bureaucracy. Such 'irregular' impositions were more regular than usually thought.
bibl.seg: ADAMS Colin, Irregular Levies and the Impact of the Roman Army in Egypt.

Lukas DE BLOIS and Elio LO CASCIO (Edd.), with the aid of Olivier HEKSTER and Gerda DE KLEIJN, The Impact of the Roman Army (200 BC - AD 476). Economic, Social, Political, Religious and Cultural Aspects. Proceedings of the Sixth Workshop of the International Network Impact of Empire (Roman Empire, 200 B.C. - A.D. 476), Capri, March 29 - April 2, 2005 = Impact of Empire. 6 (Leiden - Boston, 2007) pp. 281-291.
